intro: Rudgea sprucei, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a violet or purple tinge. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to the cold, harsh conditions of its habitat. Rudgea sprucei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
